issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Cookies are required for use of the user console, the console should detect that cookies are not enabled and warn the user.

Currently the user waits for a minute and then the following message is displayed:

{code}
An unexpected connection error occurred. Please try again later. If you continue experiencing problems, please contact your cloud administrator.
{code}

On closing the dialog the user is shown the log in screen.

The console log output when this occurs is:

{code}

2012-11-21 15:13:24 INFO 200 POST / (192.168.7.1) 79.09ms
2012-11-21 15:13:24 INFO 304 GET /images/dots32.gif (192.168.7.1) 0.44ms
2012-11-21 15:13:24 WARNING 403 POST /ec2?Action=DescribeInstances (192.168.7.1): XSRF cookie does not match POST argument

fields.summary: Should warn user if cookies are not enabled

comments.body:
Agreed. The warning should say:
"Warning! Cookies are not enabled on your browser.
To use the Eucalyptus User Console, please enable cookies in your browser's settings."
There should simply be a close button on the dialog.
Need to reassign to a developer to implement.
